news_header: The University of Lapland faced allegations of good scientific practice concerning Törhönen's dissertation, which was rejected by the Faculty Council. An ongoing appeal process is in place.
news_text: A year ago, the University of Lapland received two reports of good scientific practice related to the dissertation process. The Faculty Council rejected Törhönen’s dissertation in December, following a careful review. Rector Antti Syväjäven stated that pre-inventors Göte Nyman and Ilkka Huovio, along with directors Mauri Up-Kotola and Kaarina, were not guilty of ignorance. The decision was based on a research team report. Törhönen's adjustment claim was rejected, and an appeal is currently ongoing. The university has temporarily suspended the rectification application while investigating the allegations of good scientific practice violations.
